svg.title: Figure 4: Relationship of Plans. National Oil and Hazardous Substances Pollution Contingency Plan (NCP) National Response System (NRS) connects NCP to Regional Contingency Plans (RCPs) National Response System (NRS) connects RCPs to Area Contingency Plans (ACPs) National Response System (NRS) also connects ACPs to Federal Agency Internal Plans, State/Local Plans, Vessel Response Plans (VRPs), and Facility Response Plans (FRPs) (each of which integrates with the ACP). NRS coordinates National Oil and Hazardous Substances Pollution Contingency Plan with International Joint Plans and Federal Response Plans. NRS also coordinates International Joint Plans with Regional Contingency Plans and Area Contingency Plans. NRS also coordinates the Federal Response Plan with Regional Contingency Plans.

text.tspan: Plans of the National Response System (NRS)
Points of coordination with the NRS
